content:
Diagnosis:
Extrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma, stage IIA (T2bN0M0)

Surgery:
15 January 2024 - Whipple's procedure

Histology:
Moderately differentiated cholangiocarcinoma, R0 resection margins, no lymphovascular invasion. FGFR mutation negative.

Previous medical history:
Type 2 diabetes
Hypertension

Current medications:
Gemcitabine/Cisplatin adjuvant chemotherapy
Metformin
Ramipril

Current situation:
Cycle 4 of 6 planned cycles adjuvant Gemcitabine/Cisplatin

I reviewed [redacted name] today who is tolerating adjuvant chemotherapy well. Blood tests show stable renal function and acceptable haematological parameters. Latest CT scan from 15 April 2024 shows post-operative changes only with no evidence of recurrence. Liver function tests remain within normal range.

The plan is to proceed with cycle 5 today and arrange follow-up CT chest/abdomen/pelvis prior to final cycle. We will see her again in clinic in 3 weeks time before cycle 6.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: moderately differentiated cholangiocarcinoma, R0 resection margins, no lymphovascular invasion

cancer_timeline.value: CT scan shows post-operative changes only with no evidence of recurrence

patient_facts.value: Stable renal function and acceptable haematological parameters
Liver function tests within normal range

status_updates.value: Stage IIA cholangiocarcinoma post Whipple's procedure. Currently receiving adjuvant chemotherapy with good tolerance and no evidence of recurrence
Continuing with cycle 5 of planned 6 cycles Gemcitabine/Cisplatin
Review in clinic in 3 weeks before cycle 6
